sub_topic: Determining the rank of a matrix
message_2:
To determine the rank of matrix A using Gaussian elimination method, we need to perform row operations to get the matrix in row-echelon form.

Matrix A:

\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & 4 \\ 2 & 4 & 8 \\ 3 & 6 & 12 \end{bmatrix}

Step 1: Subtract 2 times the first row from the second row and 3 times the first row from the third row.

\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & 4 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 \end{bmatrix}

Now, the matrix is in row-echelon form. The rank of a matrix is the number of non-zero rows in its row-echelon form.

In this case, there is only 1 non-zero row.

Therefore, the rank of matrix A is 1.
